intro: Osbeckia walkeri var. bechetii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial with slender, branching stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. This variety is part of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
